
# inner_multi.proto API Document

*Document generated by protoc-gen-markdown. DO NOT EDIT!*

> APIs


* [InnerMulti](#innermulti) - Inner multi counter service.


	* [Get (/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{type}/{relate_ids})](#get) - Multi get counter values.


	* [Set (/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{type})](#set) - Multi set counter values.


	* [Mix (/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{types}/{relate_ids})](#mix) - Mix gets counter values.





<h2 id="innermulti">InnerMulti</h2>

>  Inner multi counter service.



<h3 id="get">Get</h3>

>  Multi get counter values.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{type}/{relate_ids}`
	* Method: `GET`


* Request Type: ***MultiKeys***

>  Single key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_ids|array [string]|string| Counter relate IDs|-|false|
|values|map\<string, int64\>|object| Counter key values|-|false|






* Response Type: ***MultiKeys***

>  Single key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_ids|array [string]|string| Counter relate IDs|-|false|
|values|map\<string, int64\>|object| Counter key values|-|false|



> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "product": "string",
  "type": "string",
  "relate_ids": [
    "string"
  ],
  "values": {
    "string": "string($int64)"
  }
}
```




<h3 id="set">Set</h3>

>  Multi set counter values.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{type}`
	* Method: `POST`
	* Content-Type: `application/json`

* Request Type: ***MultiKeys***

>  Single key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|type|string|string| Counter type|-|true|
|relate_ids|array [string]|string| Counter relate IDs|-|false|
|values|map\<string, int64\>|object| Counter key values|-|false|




> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "product": "string",
  "type": "string",
  "relate_ids": [
    "string"
  ],
  "values": {
    "string": "string($int64)"
  }
}
```



* Response Type: ***Empty***

>  A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
>  empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
>  or the response type of an API method. For instance:
> 
>      service Foo {
>        rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty);
>      }
> 
>  The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|

<h3 id="mix">Mix</h3>

>  Mix gets counter values.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/counter/inner/multi/{product}/{types}/{relate_ids}`
	* Method: `GET`


* Request Type: ***MixKeys***

>  Mix key.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|product|string|string| Counter product|-|true|
|types|array [string]|string| Counter types|-|false|
|relate_ids|array [string]|string| Counter relate IDs|-|false|






* Response Type: ***MixValues***

>  Mix values.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|types|map\<string, [MixValue](#mixvalue)\>|object| Counter types|-|false|



> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "types": {
    "string": {
      "values": {
        "string": "string($int64)"
      }
    }
  }
}
```
